page.title: 01LAND USE
page.content: THE SURVEY AREA DIVIDES INTO TWO _ A LOW LYING DRAINED MARSHLAND NEAR THE COAST,BACKED BY RISING GROUND NEAR GREENHILL AND HERNE. IN 1985 THE MAJORITY LAND COVER WAS INCREASINGLY RESIDENTIAL. THE CENTRAL TOWN COMPRISES VICTORIAN, EDWARDIAN AND 1930'S HOUSING PLUS MODERN FLATS. THERE ARE VILLAGE HOUSES AND POST WAR HOUSES AND BUNGALOWS IN HERNE. GREENHILL IS A MODERN EXPANDING HOUSING AREA. THE REST OF THE SURVEY AREA COMPRISES A GOLF COURSE,A LARGE CEMETERY AND LAND UNDER CULTIVATION. WITHIN THE OLD PART OF THE TOWN THERE ARE NUMEROUS COMMERCIAL PROPERTIES MAINLY SMALL GENERAL STORES. THE AREA IS BISECTED BY A MAJOR ROUTE KNOWN LOCALLY AS THE{"THANET WAY"}ALSO A MAIN LINE RAILWAY WITH A STATION AND ASSOCIATED DISTRIBUTION DEPOTS.
